titles.title: To designate the United States courthouse to be constructed at 8th Avenue and Mill Street in Eugene, Oregon, as the "Wayne Lyman Morse United States Courthouse".

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Subcommittee on Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management Discharged.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 107-428.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 149.

action.text: Mr. LaTourette moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2672.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.subcommittee: Economic Development, Public Buildings and Emergency Management
committee.name: House Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 5/2/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Designates the U.S. courthouse to be constructed at 8th Avenue and Mill Street in Eugene, Oregon, as the Wayne Lyman Morse United States Courthouse.
